title: Why do Scots wear kilts? - Quora

response.answer_text: Original Question: “Why do scots wear kilts?” Men in Scotland, and not just Scots by birth, will often wear kilts to formal events, particularly weddings, graduations and dances or ceilidhs. They sometimes also wear them less formally, for example with a jumper and hiking boots to rugby matches and outdoor events. It’s a pretty much a sure fire way of getting a lift if you’re hitch hiking abroad. Men look and feel fantastic in kilts. You see them stand differently and develop a swagger. It’s extremely attractive! My son recently went to a university dance with Polish and Iranian friends. All wore kilts, and they looked wonderful. The kilt has been worn since at least the 16th Century. Before that, Medieval men wore longer tunics with a heavy woollen cloak. When wool became more available this outfit mutated into recognisable Scottish garb. The tunic gradually became shorter, ultimately into a long loose linen shirt (the cutty sark). Meantime, the wool cloak became bigger and was used as a `multi-functional wrap. Two bolts of cloth were sewn together lengthwise. The wearer arranged these into pleats and belted it around the waist. The lower bolt of cloth hung down to the knee. The upper half could be wrapped around the body as a warm and almost windproof covering. This is how the “great kilt” - the feileadh Mòr came into being. At night, the kilt was taken off and became a large blanket or make-shift shelter. They were incredibly practical, and would have been partly responsible the Highlanders’ survival in a variable and often harsh climate. A description from 1746 states: The garb is certainly very loose, and fits men inured to it to go through great fatigues, to make very quick marches, to bear out against the inclemency of the weather, to wade through rivers, and shelter in huts, woods, and rocks upon occasion; which men dressed in the low country garb could not possibly endure. [See Ref] Around the late 17th - early 18th Century, a less cumbersome version of the kilt, the fèileadh beag, was developed. Essentially, this was made from one bolt of cloth, omitting the the over-shoulder plaid. The pleats were permanently stitched into place, so the cloth could no longer be opened into a blanket. It is this form of the kilt which survives to the present day. I get enthusiastic on this subject and could all too easily write more. If anyone wants further details about the history of kilts, including how they were banned following the Jacobite uprising of 1745, send me an A2A. I will close now before this becomes a dissertation. Reference Forbes, Lord Culloden, Duncan (1815), Culloden Papers, London: T Cadell & W Davies, p. 289 .

History Of Kilts The kilts have an old history that goes back to the 16th century, where there was no concept of a kilt. At that time, the kilt was not a short dress and not designed to cover the bottom part of the men. In the 16th century, the full-length woolen cloth was used to cover not only the bottom part of the body but also cover the whole body including one shoulder. The woolen cloth came in different colors and this cloth was soft but make you warm in the winter. In that area, this was treated as a dress for poor people because most of the poorer wear this cloth every season. The military men and soldiers also wore this cloth to protect from the enemy during wars. Ban On woolen cloth After the 17th century, it was widely worn by the people of different countries which mainly include Scotland and Ireland but in the mid of this century, the government imposed restrictions on wear the woolen cloth. The government announced 6th-month imprisonment and a heavy fine on the people who wear any woolen cloth such as shawls, cushions, pants, hats, etc. This ban lifted in the 18th century and the general public can able to wear any woolen dress in regular routine work. Evolution of Tartan Kilts The evolution of the original form of kilts tarts from the 18th century. At that time, there were only a few tartan colors available which belong to Scottish clans. There was no concept of the district and universal tartans. At the beginning of the 19th century, many scholars work on the kilts and discover many beautiful tartan colors. In this century there is no concept of utility kilts, hybrid kilts, and other types of kilts and also there were not so many kilt designs. Evolution of Modern Kilts The evolution of Utility kilts such as utility kilts starts in the 20th century. At that time the kilt was made in cotton and tartan but having pockets, straps, belt loops, and other exciting features. This was the time when non-Scottish people also loves to wear this traditional dress. The current form of kilts beginning from the 21st century. Now there are so many designs, colors, and varieties of kilts available in local and international markets. It is now the fashion in the garment industry which beat pants, shorts and other bottom wears. Types Of Kilts There are many kilts for sale available in the international market. You must know the types of kilts before purchasing any kilt. The popular types of the kilts (which are easily available) are given below Utility kiltsHybrid kiltsCamouflage kiltsTartan kiltsLeather kiltsDenim KiltsUtility Kilts These are the modern form of the kilt which has all the basic features of the utility kilts such as pockets, straps, buckles, buttons, studs, and belt loops. Nowadays there are modern utility kilts available which have not only basic features but also advanced features which make them more eye-catching. The advanced features in the utility kilts include chains, metal clips, designs belt loops, leather straps, leather patches, removable hooks, new design buttons, and chains. Hybrid kilts These are also modern type of kilts but it comes in two different fabrics and colors. Most of the hybrid kilts are made in cotton cloth but there also some hybrid kilts which have two different fabrics such as tartan, velvet, leather, denim, and camouflage. These kilts are luxury kilts which look better and more beautiful than simple basic utility kilt. Camouflage kilts This is the army type kilt which has mostly greenish shades. The camouflage cloth is the cotton cloth but it does not have normal cotton colors, it has a different army and military colors. Well, this kilt mostly wears by soldiers, military, and army men on the duties. This type of kilt is uniform in many countries. The camouflage cloth also comes in different beautiful colors. Tartan kilts It is the traditional form of the kilts which not only like traditional mind lovers but also modern people. These are culture dress which is still popular in this century but now the tartan has more colors and designs than before. Leather kilts These are made from the original sheep, cow, and other animal skin. Leather kilts are expensive kilts and these type of kilts are not easy to make as it requires much experience. If you are a leather lover, then you will find more beautiful kilts in many kilt stores. Denim Kilts These kilts are made from hard cotton material. This is a jeans type of stuff which you can see in many pants and jackets. Denim kilts also have too many designs and varieties because it is a modern kilt. You can easily buy one from many retail kilt stores.
